attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Once a company goes into liquidation or administration the liquidators swallow up any future realisations with their extortionate fees.  This often leaves creditors with less than a penny in the pound agasinst their losses.  Liquidators typically charge in excess of £150 per hour for cashiers with a typical partner fee being in excess of £450 per hour.  These are unrealistic in the business word, support staff fees are around £60 per hour!  These fees are imposed against 'captive' creditors who have no option to 'shop around' for a more realistic alternative.  Liquidator fees should be capped, they are thriving in the recession.  They should also not be allowed to 'jump the queue' and become preferential creditros, receiving their money before trade creditors who themselves are struggling.
